issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Application master fails to register when hadoop authorization is enabled.

DistributedSchedulingAMProtocol connection authorization fails are RM side  

Issue credits: [~BilwaST]
fields.summary: [DS] AM registration fails when hadoop authorization is enabled

[~bibinchundatt], thanks for working on the issue. 

Is this a regression in 3.1.x? If yes, could u add a link of which patch breaks the behavior. If no, given this patch added new fields which I think is a new feature, should we move it to 3.2.0 to de-risk 3.1.1 release?

Thank you [~leftnoteasy] for looking into issue

From 3.0.0 we mentioned Distributed Scheduling(YARN-2877) as a feature. But with hadoop authorization enabled (overall cluster/ all services) is enabled feature is not working. IIUC we should consider this as bug since we havn't mentioned as limitation any doc with authorization DS will not work.

cc:/ [~asuresh]/[~kkaranasos]

Thoughts??

Thanks for raising this [~bibinchundatt].
I vote that we target this patch for 3.2.0 and in the next 3.0.x and 3.1.x releases, we update the documentation stating that Distributed Scheduling is incompatible with authorization. Do not think it is right to add new config parameters to dot releases.

[~asuresh]

Could you help out with the review.. Any other area we have to handle ??
Patch newly added protocol to existing providers (NM and RM providers) .

I have tested the same in local cluster and is working fine. 
When security is enable normally all existing cluster authorization is also enabled in our case . Feature will become not useful.

w.r.t the patch, it looks fine. Any reason why we want to do lazy initialization of the Policy ? To be honest, it does not look really heavy weight and I'd think it is better to initialize all these things up front when the NM/RM starts up.

Thank you [~asuresh] for review

Attached updated patch correcting findbugs.

RMPolicyProvider was already updated as part of YARN-1459. NMProvider i made it consistent.Other changes to have single instance over all to NM, only incase authorization is enabled.

I hope its fine.
